decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The London Borough of Hounslow as the Local Planning Authority hereby certify that on 25/09/2024 the proposal as shown on the drawing(s) submitted on 16/09/2024 and numbered Unnumbered Site Location Plan, 1554-L1, 1554-L2, 1554-L3, 1554-L4, 1554-L5 was not lawful within the meanings of Section 191 and 192 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. 
The development fails to comply with the terms of Class A, Clause A.1(j)(i), (j)(ii), (j)(iii) and Class E, Clause E(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) because the submitted plans show the outbuilding would attach to the side wall of the side extension which would exceed 4 metres in height, be more than one storey and have a width greater than half the width of the original dwelling and the applicant has not demonstrated that the siting of the outbuilding so close to the side of the two storey extension, that is under construction, is a reasonable requirement for the intended use.
description: Certificate of lawfulness for the proposed erection of an outbuilding in the rear garden
